msContents.summary: Lease of 5 arourae of royal land at Tebtunis from Pakebkis to Orseus for one year, the total rent being 37 1/2 artabas of wheat.

msItemStruct.note: Margins: left, 1.4 cm.; bottom, 1 cm. In upper left corner, in red ink: 445. On verso, in black ink: T98.
12th year (of the Emperor Hadrianus or Trajanus?)
Bancroft Library, Univ. of Calif., Berkeley

layout.ab: 19 lines, on recto along the fibers

handDesc.p: Four different hands, all regular cursives: 1, body of contract (lines 1-2); 2, subscription of Pakebkis (lines 3-11); 3, subscription of Orseus (lines 12-17); 4 registration mark of record office (lines 18-19).

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

keywords.term: Contracts, Roman Period; Leases, Roman Period

div.ab: � with a scar on the right eyebrow, and (subscriber) of Orseus (is) Didumos son of Kronion, about 34 years old. (2nd hand) I, Pakebkis son of P� have lent for only the twelfth year the five arouras of crown land in two parcels, of which the first parcel is four arouras in the so-called Laarchikos gue, and the second parcel the remaining one aroura in the sixth gue, the rent for the total being, without seed, thirty seven and a half artabas of wheat (measured) with the four-choinix measure of the granary of the god, as stated above. Psenkebkis, his son, has written for him, because he does not know letters. (3rd hand) I, Orseus, son of Kronion, Perses of the Epigone, I have rented the five arouras of crown land for only the twelfth year, the rent for the total being thirty seven and a half artabas, the transport costs being the responsibility of me, as stated above. Didumos son of Kronion has written for him because he does not know letters. (4th hand) Registered through the record-office in Tebtunis. (On the verso) Lease of Pakebkis to Orseus, 5 arouras.

listBibl.bibl: P.Tebt., II.445; SB v. 14, no. 12192. C. Gallazzi, ZPE v. 31, p. 89-91.
